description.narrative:
PLEASE REVIEW YOUR ANSWER AS THE QUESTION HAS BEEN CHANGED
”Documention Center of Cambodia” (DC-Cam) söker medel från Ambassaden för att finansiera sitt planerings- och utvecklingsprojekt för Tuol Sleng museet (”Tuol Sleng Museum Development Plan Project”) under perioden 1 mars 2014 till 28 februari 2015. DC-Cam har sedan många år organiserat liknande projekt med fokus på historisk dokumentation av Khmer Rouge, utbildning om folkmord och ansvarsutkrävande. Det svenska stödet bedöms indirekt främja Khmer Rouge tribunalens (ECCC) arbete för rättvisa och ansvarsutkrävande, då tekniskt stöd från DC-Cam gör det möjligt för museet att ordna fler tillfälliga utställningar om Khmer Rouge i anslutning till utställningen ”Dinner with Pol Pot”. Projektet förväntas öka medvetenheten och kunskapen om folkmordet, och bidra till läkandeprocessen, inte bara för museibesökarna men för hela Kambodjas befolkning, i synnerhet för yngre kambodjaner födda efter regimens fall.

The proposed intervention is a limited, one-year-contribution to the Documentation Centre of Cambodia (DC-Cam) for the further improvement of the exhibits at the Toul Sleng Genocide Museum. The project will include the following activities: 1) refurbishing and revitalizing existing DC-Cam exhibits; 2) installing four video exhibits featuring archival footage of the Toul Sleng prison from 1979; 3) developing and installing a permanent exhibition on child survivors of Toul Sleng, 4) providing temporary photographic exhibitions based on DC-Cam's photographic archives, and 5) installing a temporary exhibition entitled "Dinner with Pol Pot", which is a an exhibition about the visit of a group of Swedes to Cambodia under the Pol Pot regime, produced in cooperation by DC-Cam and the Swedish Museum for Living History.
It is expected that by developing and further improving the exhibits at Toul Sleng, the museum will play an important educational role by providing visitors - foreigners and Cambodians alike - with the means to interpret and understand the regime behind the S21 prison and the political and social context in which it functioned. It is also expected that the Museum will contribute to raising awareness on the Khmer Rouge Tribunal (ECCC), which Sweden is a funder of, as well as genocide in general, and thereby also contribute to preventing similar atrocities in the future.
The total cost for the proposed development and improvement work at Toul Sleng amounts to SEK 190 000 over a one-year-period (1 March 2014-28 February 2015). The limited amount of the intervention is the reason for using the Simplified Appraisal template.
